block.p: Sarah Junggren Abbe and Dr. Jim Taylor are to be married today at the home of the bride's father in Healdsburg, Calif. Gerald Sindell, who has received permission from Marin County to perform the ceremony, is to officiate.

Ms. Abbe, 34, is keeping her name. Until July she was the West Coast fund-raiser for Accion International, a nonprofit organization in Boston that provides financial support and training to small businesses. She graduated from Cornell University and received a master's degree in public affairs from Princeton.
Sarah Junggren Abbe and Dr. Jim Taylor are to be married Sunday at the home of the bride's father in Healdsburg, Calif.

Sarah Junggren Abbe and Dr. Jim Taylor are to be married today at the home of the bride's father in Healdsburg, Calif. Gerald Sindell, who has received permission from Marin County to perform the ceremony, is to officiate.

Ms. Abbe, 34, is keeping her name. Until July she was the West Coast fund-raiser for Accion International, a nonprofit organization in Boston that provides financial support and training to small businesses. She graduated from Cornell University and received a master's degree in public affairs from Princeton.

The bride's father, Charles Junggren Abbe, retired as the president and chief operating officer of the J.D.S. Uniphase Corp., an optical technology company in San Jose, Calif. Her mother, Kate Abbe of Woodside, Calif., is an editor and publisher. The bride is the stepdaughter of KÃ¤ren Dean Abbe.

Dr. Taylor, 44, is a psychologist, public speaker and author, whose most recent book, ''Positive Pushing: How to Raise a Successful and Happy Child,'' was published by Hyperion in 2002. He graduated from Middlebury College and received a Ph.D. in psychology from the University of Colorado at Boulder.

The bridegroom is the son of Ceci and Shel Taylor of Avon, Conn. His mother retired as a professor of dance at St. Joseph College in West Hartford, Conn. His father is a massage therapist at the University of Connecticut Health Center in Farmington, Conn.
